author: Special Correspondent
text:
The two-day training programme for regional-level election coordinators of eight districts concluded in the city on Thursday.

District Collector V. Sampath inaugurated the event. The Election Commission divided the officials who will be involved in the poll process into 16 different groups. State-level representatives from each group were selected and imparted specialised training in New Delhi.

The State trainers imparted training to two officials from each district in Chennai recently.

One coordinator from each of the 16 teams were identified for the regional-level training programme.

The coordinators thus selected from the eight districts of Salem, Namakkal, Dharmapuri, Krishnagiri, Erode, Tiruppur, Coimbatore and Karur participated in the training programme here.

Poll work

Experts imparted training to these coordinators on the officials to be involved in the poll work; maintenance of the EVMs; initiative for collecting the polling materials from the State Election Commission; imparting training to all types of poll officials and verifying whether the officials, candidates and media persons strictly adhered to poll norms.

They were also given tips on how to monitor the poll expenses of the candidates; facilities for the poll observers nominated by the Election Commission of India as per the norms; forwarding the report on the law and order situation daily to the State coordinators and creating awareness on poll process.
title: Training held for election coordinators
